text: Now Abraham rose early in the morning and went to the place where he had stood before the face of YHWH.
And he looked out over the face of Sodom and Gomorrah and upon all the face of the land roundabout, and he looked, and behold, thick smoke was going up from the land like the smoke of a kiln.
And so it was that God destroyed the cities roundabout, but God remembered Abraham and he sent Lot from the midst of the overthrow, having overthrown the cities in which Lot dwelt.
And Lot went up from Tsoar and he dwelt in the hills and his two daughters were with him, for he was afraid to settle in Tsoar. So he and his two daughters dwelt in a cave.

And the older daughter said to the younger,
“Our father is old, and there is not a man in the land to come into us according to the way of all the land.
Come, let us cause our father to drink wine, and we will lie with him that we may sustain life through our father sowing seed.”
And they caused their father to drink wine in the night. And the older one went into him and she lay with her father, and he did not when she lay down or when she arose. […]
And the two daughters of Lot conceived by their father.
And the older one gave birth to a son and she called his name “Moab.” He is the father of Moab of today.
